title: FW-007: Define UAT as distinct activity from QA test coordination
close_reason: UAT defined as distinct activity. QA role clarified as test coordination.

comments.author: mcgrath
comments.text: Sprint 2 identified that the QA Agent role conflates two distinct activities: (1) TEST COORDINATION — verify coverage, run suite, produce execution report, map tests to ACs. (2) USER ACCEPTANCE TESTING (UAT) — independent test cases from ACs alone, edge cases Dev missed, business-perspective validation. Current single-context LLM means QA has seen the implementation before testing it, undermining C-02. Options: (a) Human UAT writes independent acceptance tests, (b) Separate agent session scoped to stories + running system only, (c) QA Agent writes own tests from ACs before reviewing Dev tests, (d) Hybrid: QA coordinates, human does UAT. Without UAT, QA Execution Report provides coordination value but not independent assurance.

comments.author: mcgrath
comments.text: Done. QA-AGENT.md updated: test coordination vs UAT clearly separated. UAT boundary documented with C-02 reference.

FW-004: Evaluate git submodule for framework consumption
description: Consuming teams need a version-pinned way to reference the ASOM framework. Git submodule recommended. Evaluate and implement.
close_reason: Evaluated. Git submodule recommended for framework consumption. Options: submodule (recommended), copy-on-init, pip package, git subtree. Implementation deferred to next template repo sprint.

comments.author: mcgrath
comments.text:
[Governance Agent] Evaluation complete.

Options assessed:
1. Git submodule -- version-pinned, local access, standard git
2. Copy-on-init -- simple but drifts, no upgrade path
3. Package (pip) -- overhead for non-code content
4. Git subtree -- no submodule UX but harder upstream push

RECOMMENDATION: Git submodule
- Framework evolving (6 improvements from Sprint 1 alone)
- Consuming teams need version pinning
- Claude agents need local file access to skills/agents/controls
- Makefile target wraps submodule UX friction

Implementation deferred to next dry run (Sprint 2 of template repo).
Submodule path: framework/ or .asom/
Makefile target: make framework-update
